text: You'll Sing a Song and I'll Sing a Song is an album by folk singer Ella Jenkins. She is joined by members of the Urban Gateways Children's Chorus. It was later added into the National Recording Registry. The composition "You'll Sing a Song and I'll Sing a Song" was added to National Recording Registry by the Library of Congress in 2007.https://folkways.si.edu/ella-jenkins/youll- sing-a-song-and-ill-sing-a-song/childrens/music/album/smithsonian ==Track listing== # "You'll Sing a Song and I'll Sing a Song" (Ella Jenkins) – 4:20 # "Shabot Shalom" (Traditional) – :46 # "Cadima" (Traditional) – 1:37 # "This Train" (Traditional) – 3:02 # "Did You Feed My Cow?" (Traditional) – 3:12 # "Miss Mary Mack" (Traditional) – 1:56 # "May-Ree Mack" (Jenkins, Traditional) – 2:11 # "You'll Sing a Song and I'll Sing a Song (Review)" – 2:41 # "Dulce, Dulce" (Jenkins) – 1:16 # "May-Ree Mack (Review)" – 2:18 # "Maori Indian Battle Chant" :31 # "Did You Feed My Cow? (Review)" – 2:33 # "I Saw" (Jenkins) – 2:20 # "Sifting in the Sand" (Traditional) – 1:10 # "Guide Me" (Traditional) – 3:02 ==Personnel== *Ella Jenkins – vocals, harmonica, ukulele, guitar *Urban Gateways Children's Chorus – choir ==References== Category:1966 albums Category:Ella Jenkins albums Category:Folkways Records albums Category:United States National Recording Registry recordings
title: You'll Sing a Song and I'll Sing a Song
